:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hello everyone,

I just got started with the HubSpot CMS for Developers Academy course, and I’m trying to go along with the steps for local development.

I was able to troubleshoot the EACCESS error following this guide (<https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally>), but now when I run npm install -g @HubSpot/cli I get a “WARN deprecated” message.

————————

vic@Victors-MacBook-Pro local-HubSpotdemo % npm install -g @HubSpot/cli
npm WARN deprecated source-map-url@0.4.1: See <https://github.com/lydell/source-map-url#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated request-promise-native@1.0.9: request-promise-native has been deprecated because it extends the now deprecated request package, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>
npm WARN deprecated urix@0.1.0: Please see <https://github.com/lydell/urix#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm WARN deprecated resolve-url@0.2.1: <https://github.com/lydell/resolve-url#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated source-map-resolve@0.5.3: See <https://github.com/lydell/source-map-resolve#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated w3c-hr-time@1.0.2: Use your platform's native performance.now() and performance.timeOrigin.
npm WARN deprecated sane@4.1.0: some dependency vulnerabilities fixed, support for node < 10 dropped, and newer ECMAScript syntax/features added
npm WARN deprecated uuid@3.4.0: Please upgrade to version 7 or higher. Older versions may use Math.random() in certain circumstances, which is known to be problematic. See <https://v8.dev/blog/math-random> for details.
npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>

changed 821 packages in 3s

63 packages are looking for funding
 run `npm fund` for details

—————————————

Could anyone share if they’ve been able to fix this or know of a solution? :pray::skin-tone-4:

Thanks!

Hi everyone! Couldn't find a suitable channel for this, so adding here

*Multi-step forms and the onFormReady function* :arrow_right:
Reached out to our HS CSM and they were unable to help - hoping someone here knows about this:

Wondering if you can help us set up a multi-step form. I found <https://tt.teamtailor.com/users/one_more_thing?locale=en|another company> doing exactly what we need and it appears they're using the *onFormReady* function to populate email address when chaining forms rather than the terrible UX of asking for email every time.

Please could you point us to some documentation / support on how we can build this? We're hoping to test this approach this month.

> _*onFormReady*: function(form) {_
>      _var emailInput = form.querySelector("input[name='email']")_
>      _var email = "<mailto:jo.bell@codefirstgirls.com|jo.bell@codefirstgirls.com>";_
>      _if (email) {_
>       _emailInput.value = email;_
Hello, Can some one help me on this.. I am not able to see Products association data in HubSpot Dashboard. Are we going to some settings? Please help
Hello. I got two more Inbound tickets if someone is interested as less colleagues are coming. Cheers, Thomas.

I was able to find a solution with help from ChatGPT :man-raising-hand::skin-tone-4:

:pushpin: *We can still run the @HubSpot/cli "hs" commands by using " npx " first.*

However, I'm still confused as to what we could/should do if/when dependencies are deprecated and that prevents our ability to install the package globally.

*If you are a more experienced developer, could you share your thoughts on this?* :point_up_2:

:robot_face: ChatGPT's explanation for the next person who needs it: :arrow_down:

------------------------------------

The reason you were able to run the `@HubSpot/cli` commands using `npx` but not install it globally using `npm` might be related to the way `npx` works and how it handles packages.

`npx` is a package runner tool that comes with `npm` (version 5.2.0 and higher) and is used to execute packages that are not globally installed. When you use `npx`, it will check if the specified package is available in your local project's dependencies (in the `node_modules` directory) or if it's available remotely. If the package is not found locally, `npx` will download and execute the package temporarily without requiring a global installation.

On the other hand, when you install a package globally using `npm install -g`, the package is installed in a central location on your system, making it available for execution from any terminal window without needing to specify the full path to the package.

In your case, if you encountered deprecated dependencies when trying to install `@HubSpot/cli` globally using `npm`, it's possible that the package itself or its dependencies have undergone changes or updates that might conflict with older dependencies. By using `npx`, you effectively bypass the global installation and directly execute the latest version of the package without worrying about global package management.

Using `npx` is a valid approach, especially if you encounter issues with global installations due to dependency conflicts or deprecations. It ensures that you're using the latest version of the package and its dependencies without affecting your system-wide package environment.

------------------------------------

Cheers!

Products themselves can’t be associated with other object types. How this is handled in HubSpot, is through the use of Line Items.

Line items can be thought of as instances of actual Products (though you can create custom line items that are completely unrelated to your Product records).

Line items can not have custom associations made between them and other objects beyond those HubSpot has allowed for - which is restricted to Deals and Quotes as far as I’m aware.

The schema associations won’t show up in your HubSpot settings.

If you’re looking to retrieve line items created as instances of specific products in your product library, you’ll have to either track them down using the search API through the hs_product_id property, or via some other shared property value, if applicable.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items>
Hey <@U04NWLUK399> would you mind reposting this in #showcase? Self promotion is not permitted on channels outside of that.

Hi, Is there anyone who have a knowledge for the DOI feature to the specific pages?
Now I've enabled the DOI feature in the setting / email / subscription tab, and selected the 'enable for some pages only' option. And published the DOI email by clicking creating DOI email link. during the publish, I also confirmed the DOI enabled and for only some pages option. But it is not working for my side. :thinking_face:

according to this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/set-up-double-opt-in-for-emails|article>, this should be worked as the expected. but when I submit the form in the specific page that added in the list (specific DOI enabled list), but I didn't received any email. also checked in the SPAM folder, but doesn't exist.
